title: Number Line
text: To think about this question, you might want to locate $$-3$$ and $$-7$$ on a number line.

title: Using Number Line to Reach Conclusion
text: For numbers a and $$b$$, when a is to the right of $$b$$ on the number line, we say $$a>b$$ (read "a is greater than b").
speech: For numbers a and  b , when a is to the right of  b  on the number line, we say  a is greater than b  (read "a is greater than b").

on the number line, we say   a is greater than b

title: Answer
text: Since $$-3$$ is to the right of $$-7$$ on the number line, we say $$-3>-7$$.
speech: Since  minus, 3  is to the right of , negative 7  on the number line, we say  negative 3 succeeds 7 .
